chapters.summary: This is the story of the Roland TR808 drum machine. The device came out in the early 80s and went on to transform the sound of popular music. Every beautifully crafted story is about sound. Keep your money boring is what helps you live a happily fulfilled life.
chapters.headline: This episode is brought to you by PNC BankSome people think podcasts about architecture are boring
chapters.gist: The Story of the Roland TR808 Drum Machine

chapters.summary: The 808 transformed hip hop and electronic music. A tiny knob allowed musicians to push the bass in their music farther than they ever had before. As the 808 took off, it wasn't clear if this sound had any staying power.
chapters.headline: The 808 transformed hip hop and electronic music in the 1980s
chapters.gist: The 808 Drum Machine Changed Hip Hop

chapters.summary: When drum machines were first developed, they were meant to replace live drummers. The goal was to sound like a real drum kit using artificial sounds. The 808 may have sounded artificial, but those video gamey tones were highly adjustable. That was the key to its success.
chapters.headline: When drum machines were first developed, they were meant to replace live drummers

chapters.summary: The sound of the 808 bass drum became synonymous with hip hop. The decay control basically turned the 808's bass drum into a whole new instrument. Today, artists often shift the pitch of these 808 kick sounds to create full on bass lines.
chapters.headline: The kick drum on the 808 changed hip hop forever
chapters.gist: The 808 Drum Fill Changed Hip Hop
